content.en: VTE risk prediction: Machine learning algorithms are being used to predict the risk of venous thromboembolism (VTE) in various medical scenarios. These algorithms, such as support vector machines, random forest, and logistic regression, are being employed to develop risk prediction models for cancer patients, COVID-19 patients, critically ill patients, and those undergoing surgery. By analyzing different predictors and using optimization techniques, these algorithms aim to outperform existing scoring systems and improve the accuracy of VTE risk prediction.
content.da: VTE-risikoprediktion: Maskinlæringsalgoritmer bliver brugt til at forudsige risikoen for venøs tromboemboli (VTE) i forskellige medicinske scenarier. Disse algoritmer, såsom supportvektormaskiner, random forest og logistisk regression, bliver anvendt til at udvikle risikoprediktionsmodeller for kræftpatienter, COVID-19-patienter, kritisk syge patienter og personer, der skal opereres. Ved at analysere forskellige prediktorer og bruge optimeringsteknikker, sigter disse algoritmer mod at overgå eksisterende scoringssystemer og forbedre nøjagtigheden af VTE-risikoprediktionen.
